lead_paragraph: American authorities said they have not ruled out terrorism as a motive for the killing of three American soldiers at an air base in Jordan this month.

byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Jerusalem, and Mark Mazzetti and Eric Schmitt from Washington. Adam Goldman contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By PETER BAKER, MARK MAZZETTI and ERIC SCHMITT

headline.print_headline: U.S. Sees Possible Terrorism in Jordan Killings
headline.main: U.S. Investigates Deaths of 3 Soldiers in Jordan as Possible Terrorism

snippet: American authorities said they have not ruled out terrorism as a motive for the killing of three American soldiers at an air base in Jordan this month....
abstract: Officials at United States Embassy in Jordan say investigation is under way regarding killing of three American soldiers at air base, event being treated as possible terrorist attack; officials deny any suggestions that soldiers had done something to provoke shooting.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
